rComments: I really loved Erik's teaching style. He approaches the texts with a very conversational tone and is really funny and sarcastic. He gave me very good feedback on my papers. He can come off as argumentative but its just his way of facilitating discussion and as long as you participate he will like you. Not a class you can b.s. your way through.
He's great. And hot. Why is no one talking about how cute he is? V smart also.
He's a great teacher and really cleared up some of the more difficult reading assignments. His feedback can be a little off- putting but it does help with your writing. Funny guy.

Definitely the hardest Core professor but easily the most fulfilling. Super helpful through tough assignments and helped me personally when I was experiencing difficulties. His class isn't easy but I would definitely recommend Porter core with him

Really tough teacher, you're gonna have to work. But he is really genuinely helpful and my writing improved SO much thanks to him. He's also hilarious and makes some more, um, dry readings a bit more interesting. If you're willing to put in the work, he will make essay writing a LOT easier for you in the future.

He's doing his best with what is mandatory. He seems to genuinely care about the students and offers help when he senses the class as a whole is struggling. He does have a very dry sense of humor, which is appealing to a majority of the class. Overall, not the worst professor you could get but not someone you'd stay in touch with after class.

Lit 61H was an awesome class. Erik lectures a bit like a textbook, but the material is interesting enough and the ideas are complex enough that its not hard to pay attention. The course covered a lot of different topics which were demonstrated beautifully by the course films and readings. I wish the rest of the class had been as into it as I was.

He is a little unorthodox. You go into class and you talk about the readings you've done and it's all really scattered but somehow it's very helpful. He is very thorough with his feedback when he hands back essays and thought he might not directly show it, he does care about the progress his students make. He grades off progression. Great professor

He's very smart but his personality can be wearing. He seems to be more concerned with sounding smart than with being accessible or interesting. He talks like a textbook and makes little to no effort to connect with students on a personal level. That being said, he is very knowledgeable about his subject, just somewhat long-winded and sophomoric.

This is the way I phrase Bachman's style to my friends: All lecture long, he's throwing ideas like tangled bunches of yarn at you. Unrelentingly. Nonsense. Just a mess. But, by the end of lecture, he picks up all that tangled yarn, turns around for a moment, and then hands you the most beautiful knitted sweater you've ever seen.
Awesome awesome awesome teacher.  Writing can be a very ambiguous subject to teach but he makes it crystal clear.  Very funny, in a blunt type of way.  Great class, great teacher.

I had Erik for Into to Creative Writing, and the mere fact that he placed such an emphasis on workshopping made a huge difference. The class was immensely helpful and I'd recommend anyone interested in the Creative Writing concentration take his class.

Eric was extremely helpful and because we were his first students in a class that he created (which was all Mars science fiction) he was willing to adjust the work load. With that said, it was a TON of reading, but as long as you were diligent and kept up with it then the class was a piece of cake. Eric is defiantly an instructor worth taking.
